member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.AutoHideContainer.BorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the border style for a control.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.AutoHideContainer.SizeWeight
member.summary: this is the statistical weight of the container which is taken into account when the contaner participates in a layout chain.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockSite
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties for a docking site class. The latter controls all docking operations and parts of the docking system in a host container instance. This class is instantiated only by the Dock Manager and not by the user. Inside the host container there are four docking zones controlled by the docking site for the docked content: left sided, right sided, top sided, bottom sided. Also there is a fifth special zone that fills the center of the host container, and if there are no other docking zones, it consumes all the client area of the host container.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockingSite
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties for a docking site class. The latter controls all docking operations and parts of the docking system in a host container instance. This class is instantiated only by the Dock Manager and not by the user. Inside the host container there are four docking zones controlled by the docking site for the docked content: left sided, right sided, top sided, bottom sided. Also there is a fifth special zone that fills the center of the host container, and if there are no other docking zones, it consumes all the client area of the host container.

member.summary: Docks a IDockable instance in the required DockPosition using the IDockingSite as a target.

member.summary: Activates the IDockable instance and gives it focus.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.Activated

summary.para: Occurs when the IDockable instance is activated in code or by the user.

member.remarks: To activate a IDockable instance at run time using code, call the Activate method. You can use this event for tasks such as updating the contents of the IDockable instance based on changes made when the instance was not activated.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.DockState
member.summary: Represents the state of the IDockable instance.

member.summary: Represents the type of the IDockable instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.DockPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the docked instance relative to the DockTarget which control borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a control is resized with its parent.
member.value: One of the DockPosition values. The default is Default.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.DockManager
member.summary: Gets the IDockManager responsible for the docking operations with this IDockable instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.DockingSite
member.summary: Gets the IDockingSite where the IDockable instance is docked at the moment.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the programmatic identifier assigned to the IDockable instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this IDockable instance.

remarks.para: When overriding the Text property in a derived class, use the base class's Text property to extend the base implementation. Otherwise, you must provide all the implementation. You are not required to override both the get and set accessors of the Text property; you can override only one if needed.

member.value: The text associated with this instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of an IDockable instance.
member.value: A string describing the IDockable instance

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.PreferredDockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets preferred size used when the IDockable is docked inside a IDockingSite . If the proposed size is smaller than the minimal one, the minimal one is used. The layout engine may calculate different size if the layout has some constraints, and the preffered size may not be allowed if the operation results in fault layout.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.IDockable.PreferredFloatSize
member.summary: Gets or sets preferred size of the floating container used when the IDockable is changed into Floating state.

member.summary: Gets or sets image of IDockable

span.style: FONT-SIZE: 9pt; COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA

summary.span: Represents docking manager: the “controller” component that implements the complete behavior of the docking system. It is responsible for the overall management of all subsequent elements of the docking system.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.DefaultSize

span.style: FONT-SIZE: 9pt; COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA

summary.span: Retrieves docking sites. Docking site class controls all docking operations and parts of the docking system (docking stacks) in a host container instance. This class is instantiated only by the Dock Manager and not by the user. Inside the host container there are four docking zones controlled by the docking site for the docked content: left sided, right sided, top sided, bottom sided

span.style: FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA

summary.span: . Also there is a fifth special zone that fills the center of the host container, and if there are no other docking zones, it consumes all the client area of the host container.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.DragManager
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of drag manager. Drag manager is responsible for dragging functionality.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.EnableDockingGuides
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the compass should appear while dragging the IDockables.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.AllowFloating
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether floating is allowed. Tool windows cannot float if set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.AllowHiding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether hiding is allowed or not. Tool windows doesn't hide automatically if set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.AllowDocking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether docking is allowed. Tool windows cannot be docked if set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.AllowDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether draging is allowed. Tool windows cannot be drag if set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control is at design time or run time.

member.summary: Get active document

member.summary: Get the collection of all IDockable windows in tabbed document container

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tabbed document active dropdown menu will be visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.TdiCloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tabbed document close button will be visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.TdiContainerVisible

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.MdiChildren
member.summary: Gets an array of forms that represent the multiple document interface (MDI) child forms that are parented to this docking manager.
member.returns: An array of objects, each of which identifies one of parent form's MDI child forms.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Docking.DockingManager.ActiveMdiChild
member.summary: Gets the currently active multiple document interface (MDI) child window.
member.returns: Returns a that represents the currently active MDI child window, or null if there are currently no child windows present.
